kw.name: Test: DPI With Onboard Profile For Mouse
kw.arg: {'displayName': 'G903 LIGHTSPEED', 'connection_type': 'wired', 'hub': 3856831629, 'portNumber': 6, 'features': {'dpi': ['sys']}, 'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091', 'firmware': '23.1.13', 'modelId': 'c4087', 'type': 'MOUSE', 'device_specific_features': {'lightsync': {'primary': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer'], 'logo': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer']}, 'device_settings': ['DPI Lighting', 'Startup Effect', 'Low Battery Mode', 'Firmware Version', 'On-Board Memory Mode', 'Battery Level']}, 'connection_interfaces': {'wired': {'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091'}, 'wireless': {'pid': '0x4087', 'productId': '0x4087'}}}
kw.doc: Creates sample profile and saves those into onboard mode and checks their DPI sensitivity. Also we can skip devices in the test depending on their 'displayName' and 'pid' - Run dpi test with On-Board Profile Sensitivity Test for every device. Disable onborad mode for device and change default profile DPI Reset onbord profile for device and saves earlier created profiles into onboard mode Verifies the Onboard DPI is set accrodingly Disable Onboard mode and change the profile DPI - Verify it doesn't alter Onboard DPI

kw.name: dpi.Create And Upload Onboard Profile with different DPI for Mouse device
kw.doc: Selects different profiles and assigns dpi and report rate with different values. Upload it on onbaod memory of device

kw.name: profile.Create Profiles
kw.doc: Create profiles with provided profile names if profile is already created with the same name then do nothing.

kw.name: dpi.Firmware Report Rate Test
kw.doc: Check that G HUB can assign Report Rate to the device. And the script will verify if device can be set the Report Rate by querying firmware - Select the preset Report Rate - Verify the Report Rate set to device by querying firmware

kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: dpi.Report Rate Test
kw.doc: Check that G HUB can assign Report Rate to the device. And the script will verify if device can be set the Report Rate by querying firmware - Select the preset Report Rate - Verify the Report Rate set to device by querying firmware

kw.name: backend.Get Connected Device Id
kw.doc: Gets device id of a particular device model For ex: to get device id of G502, pass the device_name argument as 'G502' - i.e. display name This keyword also saves following global variables , can be used across the tests Device Id, Slot Prefix, interface Id

kw.doc: Asserts that a message is successfully sent to the Agent.

kw.doc: Returns the 'send_message' response in json format. To be called immediately after 'Expect Message' in test cases.

kw.name: Get Attribute

kw.name: backend.Get Connected Device Id
kw.doc: Gets device id of a particular device model For ex: to get device id of G502, pass the device_name argument as 'G502' - i.e. display name This keyword also saves following global variables , can be used across the tests Device Id, Slot Prefix, interface Id

kw.name: Send Message
kw.doc: Asserts that a message is successfully sent to the Agent.

kw.name: Get Message Response From Bulk
kw.doc: Returns the 'send_message' response in json format. To be called immediately after 'Expect Message' in test cases.

kw.name: common.Does GHUB Loaded
kw.doc: If home screen is not loaded or back button is not present or onboarding screen is not appeared means GHUB is loading

kw.name: common.Does Application Encountered A Critical Problem
Expect Element
kw.doc: Asserts that an element is loaded in a timely manner. Timeout can be specified by passing a wait_timeout in seconds.
kw.msg: Failure: Selector "//div[text()='The application encountered a critical problem. Press OK to reload.']" is Not Loaded

kw.name: LOG WARNING
kw.doc: Log a warning in the report. This should be used to signify an retry of action/validation that may NOT result in failure.

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Check All
kw.doc: Keyword to check all associated processes for an error state.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: Is Element Present
kw.doc: Validates if the given element is present on the screen. If element is not found waits for default 15 sec and throws back the error wait_timeout can be specified in case if it needs to be altered dynamically Ex: Is Element Present | element_id | wait_timeout=10

kw.name: Split String
kw.doc: Splits the ``string`` using ``separator`` as a delimiter string.

kw.name: Get Length
kw.doc: Returns and logs the length of the given item as an integer.

kw.name: Run Keyword If
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments, if ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Expect Element
kw.doc: Asserts that an element is loaded in a timely manner. Timeout can be specified by passing a wait_timeout in seconds.
kw.msg: Failed to find element with selector: #home-view and attributes:{}

kw.name: Exit For Loop If
kw.doc: Stops executing the enclosing for loop if the ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: Expect Element
kw.doc: Asserts that an element is loaded in a timely manner. Timeout can be specified by passing a wait_timeout in seconds.

kw.name: Exit For Loop If
kw.doc: Stops executing the enclosing for loop if the ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: Expect Element
kw.doc: Asserts that an element is loaded in a timely manner. Timeout can be specified by passing a wait_timeout in seconds.

kw.name: Exit For Loop If
kw.doc: Stops executing the enclosing for loop if the ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: common.Click On Back
kw.doc: Clicks on the Back Button

kw.name: Click
kw.doc: Asserts that an element successfully receives a click event.

kw.name: Test: DPI Sensitivity With Sleep System For Mouse
kw.arg: {'displayName': 'G903 LIGHTSPEED', 'connection_type': 'wired', 'hub': 3856831629, 'portNumber': 6, 'features': {'dpi': ['sys']}, 'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091', 'firmware': '23.1.13', 'modelId': 'c4087', 'type': 'MOUSE', 'device_specific_features': {'lightsync': {'primary': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer'], 'logo': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer']}, 'device_settings': ['DPI Lighting', 'Startup Effect', 'Low Battery Mode', 'Firmware Version', 'On-Board Memory Mode', 'Battery Level']}, 'connection_interfaces': {'wired': {'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091'}, 'wireless': {'pid': '0x4087', 'productId': '0x4087'}}}
kw.doc: Check that G HUB can assign given DPI and Report Rate to the device. And verify it by querying firmware before and after sleeping the system - Check that device appears in the Home view and open device configuration page - Click device picture - Click the sensitivity icon - Set and verify the DPI and Report rate - Let PC sleep - Check that device appears in the Home view and open device configuration page - Verify the DPI and Report rate that set by user

kw.name: Test: DPI Sensitivity With Restart G HUB For Mouse
kw.arg: {'displayName': 'G903 LIGHTSPEED', 'connection_type': 'wired', 'hub': 3856831629, 'portNumber': 6, 'features': {'dpi': ['sys']}, 'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091', 'firmware': '23.1.13', 'modelId': 'c4087', 'type': 'MOUSE', 'device_specific_features': {'lightsync': {'primary': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer'], 'logo': ['fixed', 'cycle', 'breathing', 'screen sampler', 'audio visualizer']}, 'device_settings': ['DPI Lighting', 'Startup Effect', 'Low Battery Mode', 'Firmware Version', 'On-Board Memory Mode', 'Battery Level']}, 'connection_interfaces': {'wired': {'pid': 'c091', 'productId': '0xc091'}, 'wireless': {'pid': '0x4087', 'productId': '0x4087'}}}
kw.doc: Check that G HUB can assign preset DPI to the device. And the script will verify if device can be set the DPI by querying firmware - Check that device appears in the Home view and open device configuration page - Click the sensitivity icon - Set and verify the DPI - Set and verify the Report Rate - Restart GHUB - Check that device appears in the Home view - Verify the DPI that set by user - Verify the Report Rate that set by user
